sections.title: The Gap
list-items: I Don't know what tools are being used when I build a website using react
I can build a project with create-react-app, and I've heard about webpack, but I don't know whats going between them

sections.title: The Hope
sections.subTitle: As a developer I'd like to...
list-items: ...be able to articulate the tolls that I'm using
...be able to give at least an overview of how these tools are working together
...have my own boilerplate project where I've compiled react/webpack/babel etc.
...understand and being able to assemble a frontend app using the tools of react, webpack, babel, npm, and node.

sections.title: The Practice
sections.subTitle: Here's a few one-liners to give an overview of the tooling

list-items.title: React
list-items.content: A lightweight JavaScript library used for building component-focused UIs (almost lifted directly from their website!). In a frontend build system, React builds the entire UI from an otherwise empty html document.

list-items.title: Webpack
list-items.content: An npm module used to 'compile' or 'bundle' javascript. In a frontend build system, webpack shrinks the size of the javascript that is delivered to the browser. Webpack dev server is also used as a server during the development process.

list-items.title: Babel
list-items.content: A module that transforms code when the syntax is not natively readable by a browser. Browsers don't know what to do with JSX.
